name: Casa del Mar

reviews.text: I do my best to stay here whenever I'm in LA for work. The beach side location allows me to decompress before and after work is done. I always walk up to Bicycle Ambulance to rent a bike for the week (don't bother with the beat up crap bikes on the boardwalk). The hotel itself is opulent and comfortable. Fantastic lounge area for drinks. If possible, try to get a room above the bottom floor -- the sub-ground views from some of the rooms down there are less than great. But overall, you will be VERY happy with this hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing location will make you forget you're here for work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time at Casa del Mar, but hopefully not our last. I was a little hesitant about booking at first after reading the reviews about staff attitude, etc., but I can say that whatever problems the hotel has had in the past with attitude, it was nowhere apparent during our stay. Everyone connected with the hotel was helpful, friendly, and went the extra mile for any of our requests.
reviews.title: Came for a rest... Mission accomplished

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were just getting away for some rest for a few days and it was the perfect place. Our room was quiet and the bed very comfortable. Although a bit small, our room was near the pool and the patio very nice for hanging out.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel

reviews.text: The only qualm I had was, upon first arriving and having booked an ocean view for the two of us, our "ocean view" was looking out over a road and, in the distance, the pier... If one craned one's neck, the ocean could be seen. I'm used to ocean view being, well, more than that... The view from the bed was straight to the verandas of Shutters' rooms, away from ocean. Perhaps one must book a suite for a room actually viewing the ocean, which wasn't what just the two of us needed for a short stay.
reviews.title: Not worth the money!
One of our best experiences
reviews.text: But with that our sole complaint, and something to remedy our next stay, we will be returning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for a quick getaway. Normally we go to the St. Regis or other hotels in the Laguna area, but we wanted to stay closer to home this time.
reviews.title: a so so stay

reviews.text: I had read a review of the restaurant there and noticed the same strong body odor smell throughout the bar and restaurant area that was mentioned in the review. It is a little unpleasant to have to deal with while trying to enjoy dinner.
reviews.title: Great hotel and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge was very helpful and procured a great table at another restaurant another night and the front doorman was also fantastic.
reviews.title: great treat!
Perfection!!
reviews.text: We had a problem with our room not being cleaned. We had left early in the morning and returned at 5pm to find that no housekeeping was performed.
The room itself was very nice, but we wore earplugs all night and could still hear noises from doors etc.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this hotel. The service was not as friendly as other places but the room and the view was spectacular.
reviews.title: Gorgeous

reviews.text: Classy hotel right on the sand of Santa Monica. The room was stunning, four poster bed and New England decor. The bathroom was complete with jacuzzi plus shower. I had pier views even from the bath, which was quite cool!
reviews.title: Classy option in Santa Monica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall service was very attentive, I arrived too early and my room wasn't ready, and came back to hotel to find my bags stores and coat hanging on the closet. Nice touch!
reviews.title: Could be great, but is not
Quality Plus
reviews.text: I tried the sunday brunch, which was quite good but very packed. They turned downs even a few guests for lack of reservation. Would definitely return here, as this is the best spot on the beach and a very comfortable property indeed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, nice rooms, excellent breakfast, partly top service.
reviews.title: Possibly best place I have stayed

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in August 2006. It wasn't cheap but the location was good. Although the room wasn't huge, it was ok and the bathroom with jacuzzi were nice (the jacuzzi did choose to come on in the middle of the night though!) We didn't eat much in the hotel so can't really comment on that. However, the reason I felt the need to write this review was because we believe our visa card was cloned whilst staying here. On a couple of occasions I left my purse in the hotel room (silly I know but there wasn't any cash in it). It was after we got home that we found out over £1000 had been used on my account at certain locations in the States. i hadn't used my card while in the States and I can categorically say that was the only time my visa card wan't in my possession. Seems that either the lovely smiling Hispanic housekeepers or the equally smiling maintenance staff had gone through my purse. I did write to the hotel to warn them of this happening and asked for their comments - I'm still waiting for their response!!!! So travellers, beware...... always lock your possessions in the safe or keep them with you! ;-(
reviews.title: Keep your possessions with you or locked in the safe!

reviews.text: Watch out how these thieves charge for the hidden things, read the fine print or you could pay through your nose. I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone. The don't care for the customer, they are just interested in making money.
reviews.title: Pirates !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a very nice stay last year at the Shutters we decide to try the casa this year. Bad choice ! Made the resa via LHW and asked for a full oceanview room. Room was nice but very noisy because of the machines on the roof. After someone from the hotel came and said that it was not possible to fix the noise, we asked to change for a same category room and we got a much smaller parking view room and were told it was the same !!
reviews.title: worst experience in Santa Monica

reviews.text: Except for the technician who came to check the noise the people were very rude, when we decide to leave the hotel the day after we were told that we were lucky because we did not have anything to pay because of our earlier departure !?
reviews.title: OK, not great.

reviews.text: As the Shutters was full we stayed at the Viceroy to finish our holiday and it was perfect.
reviews.title: Great Location, Cool Service, Lovely Rooms

likes.liked: — The bed is the most comfy one I ever slept in. The jacuzzi bathtub is really cool and the huge glass enclosed shower is outstanding. The window in the bathroom makes it so spacious and airy. The colors make you feel at home

reviews.text: This is a lovely, generally quiet hotel with a dash of 40s Hollywood glamour. The rooms are nice, the ocean views pleasing. For the price, though, I would expect a better mini-bar and a room layout that oriented itself more toward the water view that I had paid $900/night for! As it stood, the lounge chairs and table were pushed into a blind corner, and the minibar was a dorm fridge stuffed into a closet, which heated up like a sauna as a result.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel at a Price

likes.disliked: — decor not oriented toward view and overheating minibar in a closet

reviews.title: Do Not Stay At This Hotel
reviews.text: The public areas are architecturally stunning; the new fish restaurant a little gem when it comes to the sushi and crudo. The cooked dishes are not all that special in our experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, the staff is lovely and the beach concierge service at the sister hotel, Shutters, truly perfect.
reviews.title: Eight months later and I still think about it all the time! Wonderful!

reviews.text: I'd go back, although I wouldn't consider this one of the all time best values. I understand now that to truly experience the luxury of this hotel, one needs to shell out for an ocean view suite, which definitely doesn't come cheap.
reviews.title: Wonderful week for our family
Icky smell
reviews.text: Hotel is totally overrated. It is a 4 star hotel masquerading as a 5 star. That would not be so bad but the rooms are TINY. Nothing like what is on the website. We found the staff rude and the food was not great. Overall it was extremely disappointing. Feel free to contact me directly for further details of what happened to us on our stay at this hotel.

I recently booked a two night stay at Casa Del Mar in Santa Monica for a biz/leisure trip in downtown LA. I chose the hotel because of its great location ( next door to Shutters) and upon arrival found the lobby and photos from the website to be exact matches. No surprises on the look of the hotel and the staff is highly professional. The lobby, the bar, the lounge is all lovely and impressive and great for people watching as the sun sets in the evening. I had drinks both nights and an excellent ( and expensive) dinner in the lobby bar one evening. Breakfast was taken next door at its sister hotel. I booked the room thru my corp travel service which has a standing request for "high floor, balcony room" in its preferences.
reviews.title: Would like to try it again, but...

reviews.text: I arrived about 2pm on a Friday and was told the room was not ready yet. My bags were checked and I was given a pass to the pool ( a very tiny for decoration type pool ) , but after a cross country flight, it was a nice sunny spot to relax in a pool chair while waiting. The front desk called my cell to alert me that the room was ready and when I'd come back to the lobby, they had already sent my bags up. The room was on the 2nd floor on a corner facing the street side of the hotel. My view was a fire escape and the apt bldg across the street. When I asked if i could move to another room with something of a better view ( they do not have balconies, but did note my request for a high floor) I was told that because of a wedding the following night, there was no other room available and that this was the best that they could do. The room was very nicely decorated and had a large comfy bed, however, the bed took up so much floor space that I injured my leg bumping into the ends of it as I moved around the room.
reviews.title: Great visit all around!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would strongly consider staying at the Casa del Mar again just for the location, but I was very disappointed that the fact that I was a two-night/three day weekend stay from the east coast did not warrant more effort for an upgrade on the room. The additional spending in valet parking, the meals and drinks alone should justify the upgrade if nothing else and I know that most hotel GMs recognize that guests spend more on other services at the hotel when upgrades are made. The lack of effort was a bit lame and would make me consider another property in that price range.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Casa del Mar this week, and really enjoyed our stay! Our side of the historic hotel was just a short walk from the beach. It's very close to the boardwalk, which is great. Santa Monica is loads of fun for people watching. The staff is friendly at the Casa del Mar and the rooms are clean and comfortable. I'd recommend getting a top floor room (we were on the fifth floor) because the views are better and it would cut down on the noise. The walls are thin -- that would be my only complaint! The pool is fantastic and the location is superb.
reviews.title: Beautiful Historic hotel right on the beach!

reviews.text: My wife andIi thoroughy enjoyed our stay at the beautiful hotel on the beach. Tthis was a last minute choice for us - relatives took over our home for a week, so we decided to make it a vacation for us as well. We were understandably hesitant, having never before stayed at a hotel in our own city, but the hotel , our room, the restaurant...everything was really top notch.
reviews.title: So not worth the high price tag!!

reviews.text: we stayed at the hotel for our 5th anniversary. i was a little concerned about staying here after reading some of the reviews. but we had nothing but a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.text: the concierge and front desk were very helpful and polite. we forgot our toothbrush and it took the staff less than 2 minutes to find us a replacement, exactly what we'd come to expect from a first class hotel. the pool area is quite impressive and the view is stunning. the fitness center is nice, perhaps a little outdated.
reviews.title: Should have stayed at the Fairmont

reviews.text: the rooms were great and very quiet. we didnt hear a single sound from outside our room even though the hotel was booked.
reviews.title: Business Travelers Stay Away

reviews.text: the lobby and oceanfront bar are incredible.
reviews.title: I'm Surprised at Many of the Below Reviews...
much better than shutters
reviews.text: in summary, we had a fantastic weekend at this very romantic and friendly hotel and would recommend it highly.

reviews.title: Serenity in LA LA Land
reviews.text: Our 4 night stay was almost perfect. The first night we had a room that faced a rusted fire escape and we demanded a change. For the next 3 nights we were moved to a wonderful room with a view of the pier and the ocean. Who wants to pay premium prices to look out on a fire escape! The food in their seafood restaurant, The Catch, was excellent albeit very expensive. Happy hour in the lounge at sunset is a bargain with an unsurpassed view of the ocean. Avoid breakfast in the hotel as it is way overpriced and medicore. Walk two minutes to Main Street and eat at the Grand Orange for a healthful inexpensive breakfast.Pool area was quiet and empty during the week. A nice warm hot tub for relaxation. Away from the traffic and frenetic pace of LA.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definately return to Casa del mar. The old beauty is right on the beach and if you get a room with a direct ocean view it is beautiful. You can share activities with Shutters on the Beach, the sister property. Rent bikes and ride all the way to Venice beach and canals.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Don't miss the delicious lemon ricotta cheese pancakes for breakfast!
reviews.title: Beautiful Veranda Afternoon Tea

reviews.text: From across the country we planned an afternoon tea for 27 to be held in the Casa Del Mar's Veranda room. Working with Toby, the catering manager, was a pleasure as he was very knowledge, flexible and efficiently worked out the perfect location and event for our group. This ended up being the best of five events on the west coast. The room was beautiful and worked perfectly for our event. The view was incredible, service was great and the food was delicious and beautifully presented. Perfect spot for an event!
reviews.title: I will return to this hotel!

reviews.text: I stayed for one night with my teenaged daughter on a combined business/leisure trip. It was the perfect balance: Sophistication enough for my meeting in the lobby of the hotel; relaxed enough for my daughter to feel comfortable hanging out while I was working. The service was expert but geniune. The rooms were beautiful. I will definitely return whenever I'm in the area.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

aka: Casa Del Mar Hotel Santa Monica
description: Hotel Casa del Mar is located right on the sand in the heart of the Southern California seaside community of Santa Monica, mere steps from the Pacific Ocean on Santa Monica Bay. The hotel is adjacent to the historic Santa Monica Pier, the dynamic Third Street Promenade, Main Street, the elegant shopping and dining areas of Montana Avenue, as well as the gardens, walkways and expansive ocean panoramas of cliff-top Palisades Park.
